dbq_name: Mental Disorders (Other Than PTSD and Eating Disorders)
note: For PTSD, use the separate PTSD DBQ. This form covers depression, anxiety, bipolar, schizophrenia, and other mental disorders.

rating_criteria.description: Mental health conditions are rated based on occupational and social impairment
rating_criteria.general_rating_formula: General Rating Formula for Mental Disorders

levels.criteria: A mental condition has been formally diagnosed, but symptoms are not severe enough either to interfere with occupational and social functioning or to require continuous medication

Occupational and social impairment due to mild or transient symptoms which decrease work efficiency and ability to perform occupational tasks only during periods of significant stress, or symptoms controlled by medication

Occupational and social impairment with occasional decrease in work efficiency and intermittent periods of inability to perform occupational tasks, although generally functioning satisfactorily, with normal routine behavior, self-care and conversation
Occupational and social impairment with reduced reliability and productivity
typical_symptoms: Panic attacks more than once a week
Difficulty establishing/maintaining effective work and social relationships

levels.criteria: Occupational and social impairment with deficiencies in most areas, such as work, school, family relations, judgment, thinking and/or mood
typical_symptoms: Obsessional rituals interfering with routine activities
Speech intermittently illogical, obscure, or irrelevant
Near-continuous panic or depression affecting ability to function
Neglect of personal appearance and hygiene
Inability to establish and maintain effective relationships
Gross impairment in thought processes or communication
Persistent danger of hurting self or others
Intermittent inability to perform activities of daily living
Memory loss for names of close relatives, own occupation, or own name

exam_sections: History (Social/Marital/Family, Occupational/Educational, Mental Health, Legal/Behavioral, Substance Abuse)

initial_exam: Non-licensed doctorate-level psychologist under close supervision
VHA psychology trainee under close supervision
review_exam: Any individual eligible to conduct initial exam
Licensed clinical social worker (LCSW) under close supervision
Nurse practitioner/clinical nurse specialist/PA under close supervision

tips_for_veterans: Describe your WORST days, not just average days
Explain how symptoms affect work performance and relationships
Mention ALL symptoms, even ones you think are minor
Be honest about suicidal thoughts if present - this is critical for accurate rating
Describe sleep problems and their impact
Explain how you function in social situations
Document any hospitalizations or emergency mental health treatment
Describe any difficulty with self-care or hygiene
Explain memory problems with specific examples
common_mistakes: Not mentioning all symptoms due to stigma
Forgetting to describe impact on relationships and work
Not providing specific examples of functional limitations
Assuming examiner reviewed your file - explain everything
Not mentioning suicidal ideation when present
important_notes: Same rating criteria apply to ALL mental health conditions (except eating disorders)
Rating is based on OCCUPATIONAL AND SOCIAL IMPAIRMENT, not just symptoms
A veteran can only receive ONE rating for mental health under 38 CFR 4.130
If you have both depression and anxiety, they're rated together, not separately
PTSD uses a separate DBQ but same rating criteria
Symptom list is not exhaustive - other symptoms can support higher rating
Competency determination (managing finances) is separate from rating
